{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3144950,"name":"Kendall Seils","username":"sistakiin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/b9e5f3/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-13T21:42:20.239Z","cooked":"

Im trying to wire from a Spark to two snowblower motors, Iâ€™ve read the rules, and rule 504 states that that is legal.
Is it legal to take a two wires (Red and Black) off of the Spark Controller then, split it into 4 wires (a y connection) to the two snow blower motors?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-02-13T22:16:01.890Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":58,"reads":376,"readers_count":375,"score":365.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":426718,"topic_slug":"wiring-two-snow-blower-motors","display_username":"Kendall Seils","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56636,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/wiring-two-snow-blower-motors/426718/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3144967,"name":"Crystal","username":"CIM","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cim/{size}/3861_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-13T21:56:06.126Z","cooked":"

You cannot take a single wire and splice it into four separate wires to control two motors. Each motor needs to connect each of its two terminals to each of the two outputs of the speed controller.

What this rule lets you do is to run the two positive wires (1 for each motor) to the positive output of the speed controller, and two negative wires (1 for each motor) to the negative output of the speed controller. With the old Sparks (the ones which use screws to hold the wires in place), you could use a pair of ring terminals bolted to the same screw. With the new Spark Maxes (with wire leads coming directly out of the controller), there are a variety of electrical connectors, such as lever nuts, which will allow you to tie 3 wires together.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-02-13T21:56:46.394Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":375,"readers_count":374,"score":125.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":426718,"topic_slug":"wiring-two-snow-blower-motors","display_username":"Crystal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":11107,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Crystal is me (she/they)"},"post_url":"/t/wiring-two-snow-blower-motors/426718/2","custom_user_title":"Crystal is me (she/they)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3144978,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-13T22:12:28.179Z","cooked":"

If you mean two Y cables, yes. If you mean a single cable that splits into four, then no as @CIM stated.

If you want the motors to run the same direction, you would connect the black wires from the motors together and that to the black wire (Max) or negative output (motor) terminal, and connect the red wires from the motors together and those to the red wire/negative output terminal. If you want them to counter-rotate you would connect the red wire from each motor to the black wire on the other, then bring those two points to different MAX outputs.

Note that the output side of the motor controller is not subject to the color rules of R624 as these wires do not have constant polarity.

If you are using a MAX, be sure to insulate the end of the white wire!

GeeTwo:

Iâ€™m curious that you would want to run two gear motors, both the same direction; 90% of the time such motors that run at the same time will be counter-rotating. What is the application?

For brushed motors like the snow blower, you can just swap which lead each wire connects to in order to reverse the direction of one motor over the other.

We did this same thing on our Infinite Recharge bot. We simply wired the two snowblower motors opposite of each other into the output of the Spark and had no mechanical or rule related issues with our setup.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2023-05-20T02:15:08.426Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":89,"readers_count":88,"score":22.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":426718,"topic_slug":"wiring-two-snow-blower-motors","display_username":"Chris LaSalle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":21744,"username":"snoman","name":"snoman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/snoman/{size}/7189_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":47189,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/wiring-two-snow-blower-motors/426718/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3209011,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2023-05-20T02:31:26.909Z","cooked":"

They are using a motor controller. 1 single motor controller, for 2 motors (which, for this application, is legal, and wiring instructions are above). Your suggestion of programming one to go in each direction requires 2 motor controllers, 1 per motor.

What theyâ€™re doing instead is wiring the motors reverse of each other, which will cause the same result.
